Wholesale & Logistics Virtual Assistant (Fashion Brand)

Job Overview:
I’m the founder of Her Pony (Upgrade to see actual info), an Australian fashion label known for ethical, small-batch production — and I’m in the process of launching two additional brands. We’re looking for a detail-oriented, highly organised Virtual Assistant to manage our wholesale, supplier coordination, and logistics operations.

This is a remote part-time role (with the potential to grow) and is perfect for someone who has experience in wholesale, B2B communication, and supply chain support — ideally within the fashion or product space.

Key Responsibilities:

Outreach & Sales Strategy

* Research and identify new potential stockists (concept stores, boutiques, global retailers)
* Prepare personalised outreach emails and follow-up sequences
* Assist in developing and implementing simple **wholesale sales strategies** for each new drop or collection
* Keep outreach trackers and CRM tools up-to-date

Wholesale Management

* Manage communication with current stockists (boutiques, showrooms, online retailers)
* Coordinate wholesale orders: order confirmation, invoicing, tracking, and delivery
* Prepare and maintain line sheets, wholesale pricing lists, and digital lookbooks
* Organise sending of samples and PR packages to partners and influencers
* Maintain CRM, update stockist databases, and track outreach and follow-ups
* Create visual decks or presentation materials for buyers and trade opportunities
* Gather and organise high-res imagery, product descriptions, and line info for partners

Factory Liaison & Quality Control

* Communicate with suppliers (mainly in China) to manage sample and bulk production
* Ensure clear briefs are sent, and production deadlines are met
* Be across **quality control protocol** to ensure consistent standards are maintained
* Proactively flag and resolve issues during sampling or production

Freight, Shipping & Global Logistics

* Coordinate with freight forwarders and couriers for efficient shipping
* Request and compare shipping quotes to get the best possible rates
* Plan freight in advance to avoid delays and ensure on-time delivery
* Stay up to date with duties, taxes, and import costs by country
* Help communicate accurate delivery timelines and landed costs to stockists

Ideal Skills & Experience

* Experience in wholesale, logistics, or production (preferably in fashion or product-based brands)
* Strong communication and follow-up (confident chasing deadlines or confirming orders)
* Excellent organisation and time management skills
* Tech-savvy: comfortable using Google Sheets, Gmail, Canva, Asana, Dropbox
* Bonus: experience with Xero, freight portals, InDesign, or CRM tools

**Work Hours & Compensation:**

* 10–20 hours/week to start
* Flexible schedule (some overlap with AEDT preferred)
* Long-term potential as the business grows
* Pay: based on experience — please include your expected rate in your application
